Dialogue.Stage Direction: 6:47 AM. Mark sits at his IKEA Markus desk chair in M&S boxers and a TM Lewin shirt, anxiously toggling between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet on his HP laptop. His MetricShift Digital 'Employee of the Month (August 2023)' certificate hangs askew next to his Dartmouth Business Studies diploma.

Dialogue.Line: God, Steve from accounts has done another 'humbled to announce' post. He's got a Microsoft Excel certification. The man who logged into his own LinkedIn through the company Twitter last month is now officially more qualified than me. The digital revolution is eating its children.
Mark! Mark! The corporate world won't know what hit it! I've mastered the LinkedIn algorithm!
Oh Jesus, he's wearing my interview suit. The suit I wore to three job interviews and one disciplinary hearing. It's like watching a monkey wear the crown jewels.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jeremy bursts in wearing Mark's old M&S suit, accessorized with festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge.

Dialogue.Line: How do I look? Professional enough for the MetricShift Innovation Sundowner? I've been practicing my pitch all morning.
That's my interview suit from the Johnson account pitch. It was in the box marked 'Career Emergency Kit - Do Not Touch Under Any Circumstances.'
Yeah, well, desperate times, desperate measures. Super Hans says my sonic optimization concept could be the next mindfulness.

metadata.title: Mark's Morning Anxiety
metadata.description: In Mark's cluttered bedroom at Apollo House, Croydon, he anxiously toggles between LinkedIn and his 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet, dressed in M&S boxers and a TM Lewin shirt. The tension is palpable as he reflects on his coworker Steve's unexpected career progress. Suddenly, Jeremy bursts in wearing Mark's old interview suit, accessorized with festival wristbands and a 'Web3 Visionary' pin badge, excitedly claiming mastery over the LinkedIn algorithm and discussing his latest pitch. Mark is horrified, thinking of the suit's significance while acknowledging Jeremy's desperate act to impress at the upcoming MetricShift Innovation Sundowner.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jeremy practices his pitch in front of a cracked mirror while surrounded by empty Red Bull cans and printouts of Gary Vaynerchuk quotes. Mark anxiously reorganizes his 'Networking Emergency Protocols' index cards.

Dialogue.Line: I'm a disruptor in the sonic arts space, leveraging unique audio paradigms to create transformative experiences. Former projects include the critically acclaimed 'Sounds of the Serviced Office' EP.

He recorded the office printer at his uncle's accounting firm while high on ketamine. And now he's going to present it to Charlotte Walsh-Henderson as a productivity solution. This must be how Brutus felt watching Caesar walk into the Senate.
Jeremy, please don't say paradigm. Nobody's said paradigm since Northern Rock collapsed.
Mark, I've done my research. I've watched three TED talks and followed Gary Vee on Instagram. I'm basically a CEO already.

metadata.title: Jeremy's Pitch Practice
metadata.description: In the Living Room of Apollo House, Jeremy is seen practicing his pitch for the MetricShift event in front of a cracked mirror. The setting is cluttered with empty Red Bull cans and printouts of motivational quotes from Gary Vaynerchuk. Meanwhile, Mark anxiously reorganizes his index cards labeled 'Networking Emergency Protocols'. Jeremy enthusiastically claims to be a disruptor in the sonic arts space but is met with Mark's internal voice, revealing the absurdity of Jeremy's qualifications, hinting at his questionable past with ketamine. Mark pleads with Jeremy not to use the term 'paradigm' as he feels it has fallen out of fashion since a financial crisis. Jeremy defiantly claims to have prepared extensively by watching TED talks and following influential figures, revealing his misguided confidence.

original_scene_data.Scene: MetricShift Digital Solutions HQ - Canary Wharf Innovation Suite, 14th Floor

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The 'Ideation Zone' has been transformed for the monthly Innovation Sundowner. Fairy lights outline whiteboards covered in buzzwords. Charlotte Walsh-Henderson, Head of Digital Transformation and veteran of three Silicon Valley burnouts, oversees the arranging of kombucha stations. Mark lurks by the fruit-infused water, straightening his LinkedIn Premium name badge.

Dialogue.Line: Oh god, he's approaching Charlotte. Don't mention the band, don't mention the ketamine sound installation at the Croydon Buddhist Centre...
So, Jeremy, Mark tells me you're in the sonic optimization space? We've been looking for innovative solutions since the Great Algorithm Crisis of '23.

Absolutely. We're harnessing alpha waves and beta frequencies to revolutionize workplace productivity. It's like mindfulness meets blockchain meets that feeling when you've just had exactly the right amount of drugs... I mean, coffee.
The grown-ups are giving Jeremy real responsibilities. This must be what it felt like when Caligula made his horse a senator.

metadata.title: The Innovation Sundowner
metadata.description: In the MetricShift Digital Solutions HQ's 'Ideation Zone', fairy lights illuminate whiteboards adorned with buzzwords as the space is prepared for the monthly Innovation Sundowner. Charlotte Walsh-Henderson, the Head of Digital Transformation, meticulously organizes kombucha stations, embodying a blend of corporate enthusiasm and past entrepreneurial failures. Mark stands nervously by the fruit-infused water station, adjusting his LinkedIn Premium name badge. Tension rises as Jeremy approaches Charlotte, prompting Mark's inner monologue filled with dread about Jeremy's potential success. Charlotte engages Jeremy in conversation about his aspirations in 'sonic optimization', to which Jeremy humorously blends concepts of mindfulness, blockchain, and casual drug references, marking a disconcerting but exciting moment for Mark as he realizes Jeremy is gaining serious recognition.

events.title: Mark Observes Jeremy Approaching Charlotte
events.description: Mark watches as Jeremy approaches Charlotte Walsh-Henderson near the fruit-infused water station. He internally anticipates potential social disaster, hoping Jeremy won't reveal compromising details about his past.
key_dialogue: MARK (V/O): Oh god, he's approaching Charlotte. Don't mention the band, don't mention the ketamine sound installation at the Croydon Buddhist Centre...

events.title: Charlotte and Jeremy Discuss Sonic Optimization
events.description: Charlotte inquires about Jeremy's work in 'sonic optimization,' prompted by Mark. Jeremy responds with buzzwords like 'alpha waves,' 'beta frequencies,' 'mindfulness,' and 'blockchain,' and makes an awkward analogy to drugs before correcting himself to 'coffee'.
key_dialogue: CHARLOTTE: So, Jeremy, Mark tells me you're in the sonic optimization space? We've been looking for innovative solutions since the Great Algorithm Crisis of '23.

JEREMY: Absolutely. We're harnessing alpha waves and beta frequencies to revolutionize workplace productivity. It's like mindfulness meets blockchain meets that feeling when you've just had exactly the right amount of drugs... I mean, coffee.

events.title: Mark Compares Jeremy's Rise to Caligula's Horse
events.description: Mark, in a voice-over, expresses disbelief that Jeremy is being taken seriously by the 'grown-ups' at MetricShift. He compares the situation to the Roman Emperor Caligula appointing his horse as a senator, highlighting the absurdity of the situation.
key_dialogue: MARK (V/O): The grown-ups are giving Jeremy real responsibilities. This must be what it felt like when Caligula made his horse a senator.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jeremy sets up his DJ equipment (borrowed from Super Hans' silent disco business) while Alan Johnson, CEO of Johnson Dynamic Solutions and potential MetricShift merger partner, watches with interest. Mark tries to blend into the Herman Miller wallpaper.

Dialogue.Line: What you're about to experience is a scientifically-engineered productivity soundscape, developed through extensive research at the Croydon Buddhist Centre.

He's going to play his 'Chemical Brothers meets whale sounds' playlist to the entire senior management team. I wonder if Pret is still hiring? I could work my way up to sandwich artisan, live a simple life of honest toil...

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jeremy starts the music - a chaotic blend of electronic beats, office printer sounds, and what might be Buddhist chants or a malfunctioning air conditioning unit.

Dialogue.Line: This is exactly what we need. Raw, disruptive, authentically digital. Charlotte, sign him up for the full rollout.
Jeremy's going to get a corporate job before me. I'm going to end up working in his sonic optimization department. Maybe the French Foreign Legion is still recruiting?

metadata.title: The Disruption Chamber Presentation
metadata.description: In the MetricShift Executive Boardroom, known as 'The Disruption Chamber,' Jeremy sets up his DJ equipment while Alan Johnson, the CEO of Johnson Dynamic Solutions, observes with keen interest. Mark attempts to inconspicuously blend into the Herman Miller wallpaper, filled with anxiety about his colleague's unconventional presentation. Jeremy asserts that he has created a 'scientifically-engineered productivity soundscape' informed by research at the Croydon Buddhist Centre. As Jeremy initiates the music, a chaotic mix of electronic beats, office printer sounds, and potentially Buddhist chants fills the room. Johnson enthusiastically endorses the soundscape, indicating a potential corporate opportunity for Jeremy, while Mark reflects on his diminishing prospects.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jeremy excitedly makes tea while Super Hans sits at the kitchen table, surrounded by printouts about blockchain and meditation apps. His laptop displays the remains of his hacked cryptocurrency project 'MindCoin.'

Dialogue.Line: This is it, Jez. This is the big one. We combine your corporate sound therapy thing with what's left of my mindfulness platform. Call it 'SonicChain.' The suits'll love it.
Hans, you're a genius. We could add NFTs somehow. Like, people buy the right to different frequency ranges.
Already on it, my friend. Been coding since Tuesday. Well, since Tuesday's ketamine wore off. The Russians might've nicked my database, but they can't steal the vision.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Mark enters, still wearing his MetricShift lanyard.

Dialogue.Line: Oh good, Super Hans is here. I suppose you'll be wanting to pitch your crypto-mindfulness app to MetricShift as well?
Mark, Mark, Mark. Think bigger. What's the one thing missing from corporate meditation? Exactly - the blockchain. That, and proper drugs. But we'll sort that out in phase two.
Super Hans is going to end up on the board of directors. This is how the financial crisis started.

metadata.title: SonicChain Pitch
metadata.description: In the kitchen of Mark and Jeremy's flat, Jeremy enthusiastically makes tea while Super Hans surrounds himself with printouts about blockchain and meditation apps, using a laptop that displays remnants of his hacked cryptocurrency project 'MindCoin.' The scene revolves around their ambitious plan to merge Jeremy's corporate sound therapy ideas with Super Hans's mindfulness platform, which they name 'SonicChain.' Mark enters, still wearing his MetricShift lanyard, expressing skepticism towards Super Hans's aspirations. The tone is absurd and anxious, reflecting the chaotic intersection of corporate culture and unconventional tech ideas.

events.title: Jeremy and Super Hans Discuss SonicChain
events.description: Jeremy and Super Hans discuss combining Jeremy's 'corporate sound therapy thing' with what's left of Super Hans' 'mindfulness platform,' calling it 'SonicChain.' They consider adding NFTs to the platform.
key_dialogue: SUPER HANS: This is it, Jez. This is the big one. We combine your corporate sound therapy thing with what's left of my mindfulness platform. Call it 'SonicChain.' The suits'll love it.
JEREMY: Hans, you're a genius. We could add NFTs somehow. Like, people buy the right to different frequency ranges.
SUPER HANS: Already on it, my friend. Been coding since Tuesday. Well, since Tuesday's ketamine wore off. The Russians might've nicked my database, but they can't steal the vision.

events.title: Mark Enters and Super Hans Pitches Blockchain Meditation
events.description: Mark enters the kitchen wearing his MetricShift lanyard. Super Hans suggests that the missing piece from corporate meditation is the blockchain and drugs.
key_dialogue: MARK: Oh good, Super Hans is here. I suppose you'll be wanting to pitch your crypto-mindfulness app to MetricShift as well?
SUPER HANS: Mark, Mark, Mark. Think bigger. What's the one thing missing from corporate meditation? Exactly - the blockchain. That, and proper drugs. But we'll sort that out in phase two.

original_scene_data.Scene: The Fox & Goose Pub - Croydon High Street

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Mark and Jeremy sit at a corner table. Mark nurses a warm white wine while Jeremy celebrates with Super Hans, who's inexplicably wearing a MetricShift lanyard.

Dialogue.Line: This is gonna be massive, Jez. Could be bigger than my crypto-mindfulness app. Before it got hacked by the Russians.
I'm thinking global, Hans. Every office in the world, listening to my scientifically optimized sound solutions. It's basically legal drugs.

Jeremy's become everything I ever wanted to be, by completely misunderstanding everything about the corporate world. Maybe that's the secret? Like how a cat can survive a fall from a higher building than a human because it doesn't understand physics.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Mark's phone buzzes - a LinkedIn notification shows Steve from accounts has endorsed Jeremy for 'Digital Transformation' and 'Change Management.'

Dialogue.Line: I need another drink.

metadata.title: Celebration at The Fox & Goose
metadata.description: In the Fox & Goose Pub on Croydon High Street, Mark and Jeremy sit at a corner table. Mark, nursing a warm white wine, observes Jeremy celebrating with Super Hans, who is wearing a MetricShift lanyard. Super Hans expresses confidence about a project that he believes could surpass his previous failed initiative, while Jeremy shares his ambitious vision of globally distributing his sound solutions. Mark's internal voice reflects his envy and disillusionment as he realizes Jeremy has achieved what he wanted by misunderstanding corporate norms. This moment is punctuated by a LinkedIn notification on Mark's phone, revealing that Steve from accounts has endorsed Jeremy, adding to Mark's feeling of inadequacy.

events.title: Super Hans Pitches SonicChain
events.description: Super Hans tells Jeremy that their collaboration could be bigger than his crypto-mindfulness app, which was hacked by the Russians.
key_dialogue: SUPER HANS: This is gonna be massive, Jez. Could be bigger than my crypto-mindfulness app. Before it got hacked by the Russians.

events.title: Jeremy Envisions Global Expansion
events.description: Jeremy imagines his 'scientifically optimized sound solutions' being used in offices globally, viewing it as 'basically legal drugs'.
key_dialogue: JEREMY: I'm thinking global, Hans. Every office in the world, listening to my scientifically optimized sound solutions. It's basically legal drugs.

events.title: Mark Laments Jeremy's Success
events.description: Mark reflects in a voice-over on Jeremy's unexpected success in the corporate world, comparing it to a cat surviving a fall due to a lack of understanding of physics.
key_dialogue: MARK (V/O): Jeremy's become everything I ever wanted to be, by completely misunderstanding everything about the corporate world. Maybe that's the secret? Like how a cat can survive a fall from a higher building than a human because it doesn't understand physics.

events.title: Steve Endorses Jeremy
events.description: Mark receives a LinkedIn notification that Steve from accounts has endorsed Jeremy for 'Digital Transformation' and 'Change Management'.

events.title: Mark Orders Another Drink
events.description: Mark, dismayed by Jeremy's newfound corporate credibility, decides he needs another drink.
key_dialogue: MARK: I need another drink.

agents.name: Mark Corrigan
agents.title: Regional Digital Transformation Strategy Implementation Manager
agents.description: Mark Corrigan is an anxious corporate worker who struggles to maintain his sense of professional value in a rapidly changing digital landscape. He often feels overshadowed by his peers and grapples with feelings of inadequacy, particularly as he watches others, such as Steve from accounts or Jeremy, advance in their careers. Mark is characterized by his neurotic tendencies, focus on metrics, and a strong drive to succeed, despite the pressures of his job. His narrative often revolves around navigating his self-worth in relation to his peers while managing career anxiety and existential dread about his future.

agents.name: Jeremy Usbourne
agents.title: Sonic Visionary/Consciousness Optimizer
agents.description: Jeremy Usbourne is a creative entrepreneur and sonic visionary who aspires to merge sound frequencies with workplace productivity. Transitioning from a failed musician to a corporate innovator, he attempts to pitch innovative solutions in the tech space despite often relying on dubious experiences and eccentric ideas. Known for his chaotic, high-energy personality and unconventional lifestyle, Jeremy believes strongly in the transformative power of sound in the workplace. His narrative often juxtaposes his enthusiasm and optimism with his limited grasp on corporate fundamentals.

agents.name: Charlotte Walsh-Henderson
agents.title: Head of Digital Transformation
agents.description: Charlotte Walsh-Henderson is a seasoned executive with a background in digital transformation and a history of navigating three startup failures in Silicon Valley. Known for her intense dedication to innovative solutions and mindfulness, she is currently leading initiatives at MetricShift Digital Solutions, emphasizing the need for fresh ideas since the Great Algorithm Crisis of '23. Her leadership style is characterized by her resilience, determination, and ability to tackle corporate challenges head-on.

agents.name: Alan Johnson
agents.title: CEO of Johnson Dynamic Solutions
agents.description: Alan Johnson is the CEO of Johnson Dynamic Solutions and a potential merger partner for MetricShift. He exhibits a keen interest in innovative and disruptive ideas that can drive corporate transformation. Johnson balances strategic foresight with a supportive approach to fostering innovation, making him a respected figure in corporate leadership.

agents.name: Super Hans
agents.description: Super Hans is a disillusioned tech enthusiast and hacker who fluctuates between reality and delusion, often driven by his erratic lifestyle and substance use. His past experiences in the music industry and his penchant for unconventional ideas create a carefree and volatile approach to business. Known for combining an interest in blockchain technology with quirky concepts like mindfulness applications, Super Hans embodies an unreliable yet innovative spirit, frequently proposing outlandish ventures in unorthodox tech fields.

organizations.name: MetricShift Digital Solutions
organizations.description: A digital solutions company undergoing digital transformation initiatives. Currently being considered for a merger with Johnson Dynamic Solutions.
organizations.sphere_of_influence: Corporate digital solutions and technology sector.

organizations.name: Northern Rock
organizations.description: A British bank that experienced a financial crisis and collapse, used as a point of reference for outdated terminology.

organizations.name: Johnson Dynamic Solutions
organizations.description: A company led by CEO Alan Johnson, specializing in corporate mergers and acquisitions. It is being considered for a merger with MetricShift Digital Solutions.

organizations.description: The place where Jeremy claims to have developed his scientifically-engineered productivity soundscape. Often falsely perceived as a research institution.
organizations.sphere_of_influence: Local spiritual community; perceived (falsely) as a research institution.

organizations.name: SonicChain
organizations.description: A proposed combination of Jeremy's corporate sound therapy and Super Hans' mindfulness platform, involving NFTs and blockchain technology.

locations.name: Mark's Bedroom - Apollo House, Croydon
locations.description: A personal space transformed into a shrine of corporate anxiety, featuring an IKEA Markus desk chair and an HP laptop displaying Mark's 'Career Crisis Management' spreadsheet. The walls bear witness to his professional aspirations, adorned with his MetricShift Digital 'Employee of the Month' certificate and his University of Dartmouth Business Studies diploma, both gathering dust. The atmosphere reflects a blend of desperation and hope as Mark navigates his precarious corporate situation.

locations.name: Living Room - Apollo House
locations.description: A cluttered living room filled with empty Red Bull cans and scattered printouts of entrepreneurial quotes. The atmosphere is tense as Jeremy practices his pitch in front of a cracked mirror, while Mark anxiously reorganizes his networking cards. This space serves as a backdrop for their contrasting approaches to corporate ambition, highlighting both enthusiasm and skepticism in the face of their professional struggles.

locations.name: MetricShift Digital Solutions HQ - Canary Wharf Innovation Suite, 14th Floor
locations.description: The 'Ideation Zone' is decorated with fairy lights outlining whiteboards filled with buzzwords, creating a vibrant and creative atmosphere. It is designed for corporate innovation events like the monthly Innovation Sundowner, where employees present innovative ideas and networking takes place.

locations.name: MetricShift Executive Boardroom - 'The Disruption Chamber'
locations.description: A modern, corporate boardroom rebranded for creativity and innovation. It features sleek Herman Miller furniture, showcasing a blend of comfort and style, suited for high-stakes meetings. The space is characterized by an atmosphere of anticipation and tension as Jeremy prepares to unveil his unconventional presentation to senior management.

locations.name: Mark and Jeremy's Flat - Kitchen
locations.description: The kitchen serves as a casual yet chaotic space where ideas collide and caffeine fuels creativity. Super Hans is surrounded by printouts related to his blockchain and meditation app projects. His laptop displays remnants of his hacked cryptocurrency project 'MindCoin,' adding to the atmosphere of a makeshift tech incubator. The area reflects a blend of ambition and disarray, amplified by the presence of Jeremy excitedly making tea.

locations.name: The Fox & Goose Pub
locations.description: A corner pub on Croydon High Street, where the atmosphere is lively and informal, filled with patrons enjoying drinks and conversations. It serves as a backdrop for socializing and celebrating small victories in life and work. The corner table provides a semi-private space for Mark, Jeremy, and Super Hans, juxtaposing their personal struggles with the joviality around them.
